questions.text: Emotional reserves to absorb difficulty without destabilizing are ...

answers.4: substantial — I can weather most storms
answers.5: deep — I have real reserves for hard seasons
answers.2: thin — small things tip me over
answers.3: moderate — I can handle some difficulty

questions.text: My stability to be present for others' emotions without being overwhelmed is ...

answers.4: solid — I can usually hold space for others
answers.5: strong — I can be a steady presence in emotional storms
answers.2: fragile — I can help briefly but it costs me heavily
answers.3: moderate — I can be present sometimes
answers.1: absent — their emotions pull me under

questions.text: Emotional energy for connection and relationship is ...

answers.4: usually available — I can engage most of the time
answers.5: abundant — I have plenty for deep connection
answers.2: thin — basic connection is all I can manage
answers.3: variable — sometimes I have energy, sometimes not
answers.1: depleted — I have nothing left to give

questions.text: Processing of my own baggage so I'm not triggered by everyone else's is ...

answers.4: substantial — most major things worked through
answers.5: thorough — I've done the deep work
answers.3: partial — some things processed, others not

questions.text: Emotional wealth (peace, joy, contentment) that overflows to others is ...

answers.4: present — I usually have overflow for others
answers.5: abundant — deep wells of peace and joy to share
answers.3: developing — some to share in some seasons
answers.1: absent — I'm running on empty emotionally

remediation.advice: Emotional surplus comes from processing your own stuff (Layer 5 emotional skill) and maintaining boundaries. If you're always emotionally depleted, you're either not processing (accumulating debt) or not protecting (giving away your first cloak). Address the leak.

scripture.text: A tranquil heart gives life to the flesh, but envy makes the bones rot.
